arabicText: ٱقْتَرَبَ لِلنَّاسِ حِسَابُهُمْ وَهُمْ فِى غَفْلَةٍۢ مُّعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 people’s	 reckoning	 is	 near,	 whereas	
they	are	in	neglect,	turned	away!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Logoñ ka	 hisāb	 nazdeek	 aur	 woh	 ghaflat	
meiñ	muñh	phere	haiñ

arabicText: مَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّهِم مُّحْدَثٍ إِلَّا ٱسْتَمَعُوهُ وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Whenever	 a	 new	 advice	 comes	 to	 them	
from	 their	 Lord,	 they	 do	 not	 listen	 to	 it	
except	while	playing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	 unke	 Rab	 ke	 pās	 se	 unheiñ	 koi	 nayi	
naseehat	 āati	 hai	 to	 usey	 nahiñ	 sunte	
magar	khelte	huye

arabicText: لَاهِيَةًۭ قُلُوبُهُمْ ۗ وَأَسَرُّوا۟ ٱلنَّجْوَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ هَلْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا بَشَرٌۭ مِّثْلُكُمْ ۖ أَفَتَأْتُونَ ٱلسِّحْرَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Their	hearts	are	involved	in	play;	and	the	
unjust	 secretly	 conferred,	 “What	 is	 he,	
except	 another	 a	 human	like	 you?!	 So	 do	
you	 follow	 magic	 although	 you	 have	
perceived?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unke	 dil	 khel	 meiñ	 pade haiñ,	 aur	
zālimoñ	 ne	 āpas	 meiñ	 khufiyah	
mashāwarat	 ki,	 ke	 yeh	 kaun	 haiñ	 ek	
tumhiñ	 jaise	 āadmi	 to	 haiñ,	 kya	 jādu	 ke	
pās	jāte	ho	dekh	bhāl	kar

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّى يَعْلَمُ ٱلْقَوْلَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلسَّمِيعُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Prophet	said,	“My	Lord	knows	all	
that	 is	 spoken	 in	 the	 heavens	 and	 in	 the	
earth;	and	He	only	is	 the	All	Hearing,	 the	
All	Knowing."
romanUrduTranslationText:
Nabi ne	 farmāya merā	 Rab	 jānta	 hai	
āasmanoñ	 aur	 zameen	 meiñ	 har	 bāt	 ko	
aur	wohi	hai	suntā	jānta

arabicText: بَلْ قَالُوٓا۟ أَضْغَـٰثُ أَحْلَـٰمٍۭ بَلِ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ بَلْ هُوَ شَاعِرٌۭ فَلْيَأْتِنَا بِـَٔايَةٍۢ كَمَآ أُرْسِلَ ٱلْأَوَّلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Rather	 they	 said,	 “These	 are	 confused	
dreams,	 but	 in	 fact	 he	 has	 fabricated	 it	-
but	in	 fact	 he	is	a poet;	 so	 he	must	 bring	
us	 some	 sign,	 like	 those	 who	 were	 sent	
before.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	 bole	 pareshān	 khw’ābeiñ	 haiñ	
balke	 inki	 gadhat	 hai,	 balke	 ye	 shā’er		
haiñ,	 to	 hamare	 pās	 koi	 nishāni	 lāyeiñ	
jaise	agle	bheje	gaye they

arabicText: مَآ ءَامَنَتْ قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَآ ۖ أَفَهُمْ يُؤْمِنُونَ ٦
englishTranslationText:
There	 is	 not	 a	 township	 before	 them	
which	did	not	believe	which	We	have	not	
destroyed;	so	will	they	believe?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unse	 pehle	 Koi	 basti	 Imān	 na	 lāyi	 jise	
hamne	halāk	kiya,	to	kya	yeh	Imān	layeñ
ge

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ إِلَّا رِجَالًۭا نُّوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِمْ ۖ فَسْـَٔلُوٓا۟ أَهْلَ ٱلذِّكْرِ إِن كُنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 did	 not	 send	 (Prophets)	 before	
you	except	men,	 to	whom	We	 sent	divine	 revelations	- therefore,	O	people,	ask	 the	people	 of	
knowledge	if	you	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hamne	 tumse	 pehle	 na	 bheje	 magar	
mard	 jinheiñ	 ham	 waḥi	 karte,	 to	 aey	
logoñ!	 ‘Ilm	 wāloñ	 se	 pooñcho	 agar	
tumheiñ	Ílm	na	ho

arabicText: وَمَا جَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ جَسَدًۭا لَّا يَأْكُلُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ خَـٰلِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	create	them	without	bodies	so	they	would	not	eat	food	- nor	that	they	abide	on	
earth	forever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hamne	 unheiñ	 khāli	 badan	 na	 banāyā	 ke	 khānā	 na	 khāyeiñ	 aur	 na	 woh	 duniyā	 meiñ	
hameshā	raheiñ.

arabicText: ثُمَّ صَدَقْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْوَعْدَ فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُمْ وَمَن نَّشَآءُ وَأَهْلَكْنَا ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 then	 fulfilled	 the	promise	 to	 them,	 therefore	rescued	 them	and	whomever	We	willed,	and	
destroyed	the	transgressors.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	hamne	apnā	w’adā	unheiñ	sachchā	kar	dikhāyā,	to	unheiñ	najāt	di	aur	Jinko	chāhi,	aur	had	
se	badhne	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: لَقَدْ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكُمْ كِتَـٰبًۭا فِيهِ ذِكْرُكُمْ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
We	 then	 fulfilled	 the	promise	 to	 them,	 therefore	rescued	 them	and	whomever	We	willed,	and	
destroyed	the	transgressors.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Halāk	 kardiyā,	 be-shak	hamne	 tumhāri	 taraf	ek	Kitāb	utāri	jis	meiñ	tumhāri	nām	wari	 hai	 to	
kya	tumheiñ	aql	nahiñ

arabicText: وَكَمْ قَصَمْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍۢ كَانَتْ ظَالِمَةًۭ وَأَنشَأْنَا بَعْدَهَا قَوْمًا ءَاخَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	many	a	township	did	We	destroy,	for	
they	 were	 unjust,	 and	 We	 created	 other	
nations	after	them
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kitni	hi	bastiyāñ	hamne	tabāh	kardiñ	ke	woh	sitamgār	thiñ	aur	unke	b’ād	aur	qaom	paidā	
ki.

arabicText: فَلَمَّآ أَحَسُّوا۟ بَأْسَنَآ إِذَا هُم مِّنْهَا يَرْكُضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 they	 tasted	 Our	 punishment,	
they	immediately	started	fleeing	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jab	unhoñ	ne	Hamārā	‘aƶāb	pāyā	jabhi	
woh	Us-se	bhāgne	lage

arabicText: لَا تَرْكُضُوا۟ وَٱرْجِعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَآ أُتْرِفْتُمْ فِيهِ وَمَسَـٰكِنِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُسْـَٔلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	angels	said	 to	 them,	“Do	not	 flee	and	
return	to	the	comforts	that	were	given	to	
you	and	 to	 your	homes,	perhaps	 you	will	
be	questioned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Na	 bhāgo	 aur	 laut	 ke	 jāo	 un	 āsāishoñ	 ki	
taraf	 jo	 tumko	 di	 gayiñ	 thiñ	 aur	 apne	
makānoñ	ki	taraf	shāyad	tumse	pooñchnā	
ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 cried,	 “Woe	 to	 us,	 we	 were	 indeed	
unjust!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	 hāye	 kharābi	 hamāri	 be-shak	 ham	
zālim	they

arabicText: فَمَا زَالَت تِّلْكَ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَـٰمِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	 they	 kept	 saying	 this	 until	 We	 made	
them	cut	off,	extinguished.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 woh	 yahi	 pukārte	 rahe	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	
hamne	 unheiñ	 kardiyā	 kāte	 huye	 bujhe	
huye

arabicText: وَمَا خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا لَـٰعِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	not	created	the	heavens	and	
the	 earth	 and	 all	 that	 is	 between	 them,	
unnecessarily
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hamne	 āsmān	 aur	 zameen	 aur	 jo	
kuchh	unke	darmiyān	hai	‘abas	na	banāye

arabicText: لَوْ أَرَدْنَآ أَن نَّتَّخِذَ لَهْوًۭا لَّٱتَّخَذْنَـٰهُ مِن لَّدُنَّآ إِن كُنَّا فَـٰعِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
If	 We	 willed	 to	 choose	 a	 pastime,	 We	
could	 have	 chosen	 it	 from	 Ourselves	 - if	
We	wanted	to.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	 ham	 Koi	 bahlāwā	 ikhteyār	 karnā	
chāhte	to	apne	pās	se	ikhteyār	karte	agar	
hameiñ	karnā	hotā

arabicText: بَلْ نَقْذِفُ بِٱلْحَقِّ عَلَى ٱلْبَـٰطِلِ فَيَدْمَغُهُۥ فَإِذَا هُوَ زَاهِقٌۭ ۚ وَلَكُمُ ٱلْوَيْلُ مِمَّا تَصِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
But	 in	 fact	 We	 hurl	 the	 truth	 upon	
falsehood,	 so	 it	 scatters	 its	 brains	 -
thereupon	it	 vanishes;	 and	 for	 you	is	 the	
ruin	due	to	the	matters	you	fabricate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	Ham	Haq	ko	bātil	par	pheñk	mārte	
haiñ	 to	Woh	uskā	bhejā	nikāl	detā	hai	 to	
jabhi	 woh	 mit	 kar	 rah	 jātā	 hai,	 aur	
tumhāri	kharābi	hai	un	bātoñ	se	jo	banāte	
ho

arabicText: وَلَهُۥ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَنْ عِندَهُۥ لَا يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ عَنْ عِبَادَتِهِۦ وَلَا يَسْتَحْسِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	to	Him	only	belong	all	those	who	are	
in	 the	 heavens	 and	in	 the	 earth;	 and	 those	with	Him	 are	 not	 conceited	 towards	worshipping	
Him,	nor	do	they	tire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	usi	ke	haiñ	jitne	āsmānoñ	aur	zameen	
meiñ	 haiñ	 aur	 uske	 pās	wāle	 uski	ibadat	
se	takabbur	nahiñ	karte	aur	na	thakeiñ.

arabicText: يُسَبِّحُونَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ لَا يَفْتُرُونَ
englishTranslationText: They	say	His	Purity	night	and	day,	and	do	not	slacken.
romanUrduTranslationText: Rāt	din	Uski	pāki	bolte	haiñ	aur	susti	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَةًۭ مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ هُمْ يُنشِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: Have	they	appointed	from	the	earth,	Gods	that	create	something?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	unhoñ	ne	zameen	meiñ	se	kuch aise	khudā	banā	liye	haiñ	ke	woh	kuchh	paidā	karte	haiñ

arabicText: لَوْ كَانَ فِيهِمَآ ءَالِهَةٌ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتَا ۚ فَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَرْشِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	āsmān	wa zameen meiñ	Allah	ke	siwā	aur	khudā	hote	to	zaroor	woh	tabāh	ho	jāte	to	pāki	
hai	Allah	‘Arsh	ke	mālik	ko	un	bātoñ	se	jo	yeh	banāte	haiñ

arabicText: لَا يُسْـَٔلُ عَمَّا يَفْعَلُ وَهُمْ يُسْـَٔلُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	is	not	questioned	whatever	He	does,	whereas	they	will	all	be	questioned.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us-se	nahiñ	pooñcha	jātā	jo	woh	kare,	aur	un	sab	se	Suwāl	hogā

arabicText: أَمِ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةًۭ ۖ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ ۖ هَـٰذَا ذِكْرُ مَن مَّعِىَ وَذِكْرُ مَن قَبْلِى ۗ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ ۖ فَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Or	have	they	set	up	other	Gods	besides	Allah?	Say,	“Bring	your	proof;	this	is	the	remembrance	
of	those	with	me	and	those	before	me”;	but	in	fact	most	of	them	do	not	know	the	Truth,	so	they	
turn	away.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Kyā	Allah	 ke	 siwā	aur	 khudā	 banā	 rakhe	 haiñ? Tum	 farmāo	apni daleel	lāo	 yeh	Qur’ān	mere	
sāth	wāloñ	ka	zikr	hai	aur	mujhse	agloñ	ka	tazkira,	balke	un	meiñ	aksar	haq	ko	nahiñ		jānte	to	
woh	ru-gardāñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا نُوحِىٓ إِلَيْهِ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّآ أَنَا۠ فَٱعْبُدُونِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 did	 not	 send	 any	 Noble	
Messenger	 before	 you,	 but	 We	 divinely	
revealed	 to	 him	 that,	 “There	 is	 no	 God	
except	 I	 (Allah),	 therefore	 worship	 Me	
alone.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Hamne	 tumse	 pehle	 koi	 Rasool	 na	
bhejā	 magar	 yeh	 ke	 ham	 uski	 taraf	 waḥi		
farmāte	 ke	mere	 siwā	koi	m’ābood	 nahiñ	
to	mujhi	ko	Poojo.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ ٱتَّخَذَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ وَلَدًۭا ۗ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۚ بَلْ عِبَادٌۭ مُّكْرَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 said,	 “The	 Most	 Gracious	 has	
chosen	 a	 son	 - Purity	 is	 to	 Him!	 In	 fact	
they	are	honourable	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 bole:	 Rehmān	 ne	 betā	 ikhtiyār	 kiya,	
Pāk	hai	woh	balke	bande	haiñ	izzat	wāle

arabicText: لَا يَسْبِقُونَهُۥ بِٱلْقَوْلِ وَهُم بِأَمْرِهِۦ يَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	do	not	speak	before	He	has,	and	they	
act	only	at	His	command.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bāt	meiñ	us	se	sabqat	nahiñ	karte	aur	woh	
usi	ke	hukm	par	kār	band	hote	haiñ.

arabicText: يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلَا يَشْفَعُونَ إِلَّا لِمَنِ ٱرْتَضَىٰ وَهُم مِّنْ خَشْيَتِهِۦ مُشْفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 knows	what	is	 before	 them	 and	what	
is	behind	them,	and	they	do	not	intercede	
except	 for	 him	 whom	 He	 likes,	 and	 they	
fear	with	awe	of	Him.	(The Holy	Prophets	
and	 virtuous	 people	 will	 be	 given	 the	
permission	 to	 intercede.	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him	- will	be	the	first	to	intercede.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	jānta	hai	jo	unke	āage	hai	aur	jo	Unke	
Piche	 hai	 aur	 shafā’at	 nahiñ	 karte	 magar	
uske	 liye	 jise	 woh	 pasand	 farmāyeiñ	 aur	
woh	uske	khauf	se	dar	rahe	haiñ.

arabicText: ۞ وَمَن يَقُلْ مِنْهُمْ إِنِّىٓ إِلَـٰهٌۭ مِّن دُونِهِۦ فَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِيهِ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	one	among	them	who	says,	“I	am	
a	God	beside	Allah”	- We	shall	reward	him	
with	 hell; this	 is	 how	 We	 punish	 the	
unjust
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ		jo	koi	kahe	ke	maiñ	Allah	ke	
siwā	mā’bood	huñ	to	usey	ham	Jahannam	
ki	 Jazā	 deñge	 ham	 aisi	 hi	 sazā	 Dete	 haiñ	
sitamgāroñ	ko.

arabicText: أَوَلَمْ يَرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًۭا فَفَتَقْنَـٰهُمَا ۖ وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ حَىٍّ ۖ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	 not	 the	 disbelievers	 observe	 that	 the	
heavens	 and	 the	 earth	 were	 together,	 so	
We	 parted	 them,	 and	 we	 made	 every	
living	 thing	 from	 water?	 So	 will	 they	 not	
accept	faith?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	 kāfiroñ	 ne	 yeh	 khayāl	 na	 kiya?	 Ke	
āsmān	 aur	 zameen	 band	 they	 to	 hamne	
unheiñ	 kholā	 aur	 hamne	 har	 jāndār	 chiz	
pāni	 se	 banāyi	 to	 kya	woh	 Imān nalayeiñ	
ge

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ رَوَٰسِىَ أَن تَمِيدَ بِهِمْ وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا فِجَاجًۭا سُبُلًۭا لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	placed	mountains	as	anchors	in	the	earth	so	that	it	may	not	shake	with	them;	and	
We	kept	wide	roads	in	it,	so	that	they	may	find	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 zameen	 meiñ	 hamne	 langar	 dāle	 ke	
unheiñ	lekar	na	kāñpe	aur	hamne	us	meiñ	
kushādā	 rāheiñ	 rakhiñ	 ke	 kahiñ	 woh	 rāh	
pāyeiñ

arabicText: وَجَعَلْنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ سَقْفًۭا مَّحْفُوظًۭا ۖ وَهُمْ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	have	made	the	sky	a	roof,	protected;	and	they	turn	away	from	its	signs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	hamne	āasmān	ko	Chhat banāyā	nigāh	
rakhi	gayi	aur	woh	Uski	nishāniyoñ	se	ru-gardāñ		haiñ

arabicText: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّۭ فِى فَلَكٍۢ يَسْبَحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	is	He	Who	created	the	night	and	the	day,	and	the	sun	and	the	moon;	each	one	floats	in	an	
orbit.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Wohi	hai	jisne	banāye	rāt	aur	din	aur	suraj	aur	chānd	har	ek ek	ghere	meiñ	pair (tair) rahā	
hai

arabicText: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا لِبَشَرٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِكَ ٱلْخُلْدَ ۖ أَفَإِي۟ن مِّتَّ فَهُمُ ٱلْخَـٰلِدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	before	you,	We	did	not	appoint	on	earth	a	never-ending	life	for	any	human;	will	they,	if	you	
depart,	become	immortal?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Hamne	 tumse	 pehle	 kisi	 ādmi	 ke	 liye	 duniyā	 meiñ	 hameshgi	 na	 banāyi	 to	 kya	 agar	 tum	
inteqāl	farmāo	to	yeh	hameshā	raheñge?

arabicText: كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ ذَآئِقَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ ۗ وَنَبْلُوكُم بِٱلشَّرِّ وَٱلْخَيْرِ فِتْنَةًۭ ۖ وَإِلَيْنَا تُرْجَعُونَ ٣٥
englishTranslationText:
Every	living	being	must	taste	death;	and	We	test	you	with	harm	and	with	good	- a	trial;	and	to	
Us	only	you	have	to	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Har	jān	ko	maut	ka	mazā	chakhnā	hai,	aur	Ham	tumhāri	āzmaish	karte	haiñ	burāi	aur	bhalāi	se	
jāñchne	ko	aur	Hamāri	hi	taraf	tumheiñ	laut	kar	āanā	hai

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَءَاكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى يَذْكُرُ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ وَهُم بِذِكْرِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ هُمْ كَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 the	 disbelievers	 see	 you,	 they	
do	not	appoint	you	except	as	an	object	of	
mockery;	“Is	he	 the	one	who	speaks	ill	of	
your	 Gods?”;	 whereas	 they	 deny	 the	
remembrance	 of	 the	 Most	 Gracious	
Himself!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 kāfir	 tumheiñ dekhte	 haiñ	 to	
tumheiñ	 nahiñ	 thahrāte	 magar	 tha-thā,	
kya	yeh	haiñ	woh	jo	tumhāre	khudāoñ	ko	
burā	kehte	haiñ	aur	woh	Rahmān	hi	ki	yād	
se	munkir	haiñ

arabicText: خُلِقَ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ مِنْ عَجَلٍۢ ۚ سَأُو۟رِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِى فَلَا تَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
englishTranslationText:
. Man	 has	 been	 created	 hasty;	 very	 soon	 I	
shall	 show	 you My	 signs,	 do	 not	 be	
impatient.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ādmi jald-bāz banāyā	 gayā,	 ab	 Maiñ	
tumheiñ	 Apni	 nishāniyāñ	 dikhāuñgā	
mujhse	jaldi	na	karo

arabicText: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 they	 say,	 “When	 will	 this	 promise	
occur,	if	you	are	truthful?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Kehte	haiñ:	 kab	hogā	 yeh	w’ada	agar	
tum	sacche	ho.

arabicText: لَوْ يَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ حِينَ لَا يَكُفُّونَ عَن وُجُوهِهِمُ ٱلنَّارَ وَلَا عَن ظُهُورِهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ ٣٩
englishTranslationText:
If	 only	 the	 disbelievers	 realised	 the	 time	
when	they	will	not	be	able	to	stop	the	fire	
from	 their	 faces	 and	 from	 their	 backs	 -
and	nor	are	they	to	be	helped.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kisi	tarah	jānte	kāfir	us	waqt	ko	jab	na	rok	
sakeñge	apne	muñhoñ	se	āag	aur	na	apni	
peethoñ	se	aur	na	unki	madad	ho

arabicText: بَلْ تَأْتِيهِم بَغْتَةًۭ فَتَبْهَتُهُمْ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ رَدَّهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
In	 fact	 it	 will	 suddenly	 come	 upon	 them,	
therefore	 shocking	 them,	 and	 they	 will	
not	 be	 able	 to	 repel	 it	 nor	 will	 they	 be	
given	respite.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	 woh	 unpar	 achānak	 ā padegi	 to	
unheiñ	 be-hawās	 kardegi	 phir	 na	 woh	
usey	 pher	 sakeñge	 aur	 na	 unheiñ	mohlat	
di	jayegi

arabicText: وَلَقَدِ ٱسْتُهْزِئَ بِرُسُلٍۢ مِّن قَبْلِكَ فَحَاقَ بِٱلَّذِينَ سَخِرُوا۟ مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed the	Noble	Messengers	 before	
you	 were	 mocked	 at,	 but	 their	 mockery	
ruined	the	mockers	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	 tumse	agle	Rasooloñ	 ke	sāth	
that-ta-hā	kiya	gayā	to	maskhargi (that-tahā) karne	wāloñ	ka	that-ta-hā	unhiñ	ko	le	
baithā

arabicText: قُلْ مَن يَكْلَؤُكُم بِٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ مِنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۗ بَلْ هُمْ عَن ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِم مُّعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. Proclaim,	“Who	guards	you	night	and	day	
from	the	Most	Gracious?”	In	fact	they	have	
turned	 away	 from	 the	 remembrance	 of	
their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Tum	farmāo	shabāna roz	tumhāri	kaun	nigehbāni	kartā	hai	Rahmān	se	balke	woh	apne	Rab	ki	
yād	se	muñh	phere	haiñ

arabicText: أَمْ لَهُمْ ءَالِهَةٌۭ تَمْنَعُهُم مِّن دُونِنَا ۚ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ نَصْرَ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَلَا هُم مِّنَّا يُصْحَبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Do	they	have	some	Gods	who	protect	them	from	Us?	Neither	can	they	save	themselves	nor	save	
their	friends	from	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	 unke	 kuch khudā	 haiñ	jo	 unko	 hamse	 bachāte	 haiñ?	Woh	Apni	 hi	jānoñ	 ko	 nahiñ	 bachā	
sakte	aur	na	hamāri	taraf	se	unki	yāri	ho

arabicText: بَلْ مَتَّعْنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ وَءَابَآءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ طَالَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْعُمُرُ ۗ أَفَلَا يَرَوْنَ أَنَّا نَأْتِى ٱلْأَرْضَ نَنقُصُهَا مِنْ أَطْرَافِهَآ ۚ أَفَهُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
But	in	 fact	We	have	given	these	(disbelievers)	and	their	 fathers	a	benefit	to	the	extent	that	life	
became	long	 for	 them;	so	do	 they	not	see	 that	We	are	reducing	 the	land	 from	its	borders?	So	
will	these	be	victorious?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kiyā	 unke	 kuch khudā	 haiñ	jo	 unko	 hamse	 bachāte	 haiñ?	Woh	Apni	 hi	jānoñ	 ko	 nahiñ	 bachā	
sakte	aur	na	hamāri	taraf	se	unki	yāri	ho

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أُنذِرُكُم بِٱلْوَحْىِ ۚ وَلَا يَسْمَعُ ٱلصُّمُّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا مَا يُنذَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	 Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	“I	warn	
you	 only	 with	 the	 divine	 revelation;	 and	
the	 deaf	 do	 not	 hear	 the	 call	 when	
warned.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāoñ	ke	maiñ	tumko	sirf	Waḥi	se	
darātā	huñ	aur	bahre	pukārnā	nahiñ	sunte	
jab	darāyeiñ	jāyeñ

arabicText: وَلَئِن مَّسَّتْهُمْ نَفْحَةٌۭ مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّكَ لَيَقُولُنَّ يَـٰوَيْلَنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	a	whiff	 of	 your	 Lord’s	 punishment	
were	to	touch	them,	they	would	certainly	
say,	“Woe	to	us	- we	were	indeed	unjust!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	unheiñ	 tumhāre	Rab	 ke	‘aƶāb	 ki	
hawā	 chhu	 jāye	 to	 zaroor	 kaheñge:	 hāye	
kharābi,	hamāri	be-shak	ham	Ƶālim	they

arabicText: وَنَضَعُ ٱلْمَوَٰزِينَ ٱلْقِسْطَ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَلَا تُظْلَمُ نَفْسٌۭ شَيْـًۭٔا ۖ وَإِن كَانَ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍۢ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍ أَتَيْنَا بِهَا ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِنَا حَـٰسِبِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	 shall	 set	 up	 the	 scales	 of	 justice	
on	the	Day	of	Resurrection	- therefore	no	
soul	will	be	wronged	in	the	least;	and	if	a	
thing	is	equal	 to	a	grain	of	mustard	seed,	
We	will	bring	it;	and	We	are	Sufficient	 to	
(take)	account.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Ham	 ádl	 ki	 tarāzueñ	 rakheñge	
Qayāmat	ke	din	 to	kisi	jān	par	kuch ƶulm	
na	 hogā	 aur	 agar	 koi	 chiz	 rāi	 ke	 dāne	 ke	
barābar	ho	to	ham	usey	le	ayeñge	aur	ham	
kāfi	haiñ	hisāb	ko

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ وَضِيَآءًۭ وَذِكْرًۭا لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 hamne	 Mūsā aur	 Hāroon ko	
faisla	 diyā	 aur	 ujālā	 aur	 parhezgāroñ	 ko	
naseehāt

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَهُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّاعَةِ مُشْفِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	fear	their	Lord	without	seeing	
and	who	apprehend	the	Last	Day
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 jo	 be-dekhe	 apne	Rab	 se	darte	 haiñ	
aur	unheiñ	Qayāmat	 ka	andeshā	lagā	huā	
hai

arabicText: وَهَـٰذَا ذِكْرٌۭ مُّبَارَكٌ أَنزَلْنَـٰهُ ۚ أَفَأَنتُمْ لَهُۥ مُنكِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	a	blessed	remembrance,	sent	down	
by	Us;	so	do	you	deny	it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yeh	 hai	 barkat	 wāla	 Ƶikr	 ke	 Hamne	
utārā	to	kya	tum	iske	munkir	ho?

arabicText: ۞ وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ رُشْدَهُۥ مِن قَبْلُ وَكُنَّا بِهِۦ عَـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 We	 bestowed	 Ibrahim	 with	
guidance	 from	 the	 beginning,	 and	 We	
were	Aware	of	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	hamne	Ibrāhim ko	pehle	hi	se	
uski	 Nek	 rāh	 ‘atā	 kardi	 aur	 Ham	 us	 se	
khabardār	they

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلتَّمَاثِيلُ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنتُمْ لَهَا عَـٰكِفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	he	said	to	his	father	and	his	people,	
“What	 are	 these	 idols	 before	 whom	 you	
squat	(worshipping)?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	usne	apne	bāp	aur	Qaom	se	kahā	 yeh	
moorteiñ	 kya	 haiñ	 jinke	 āage tum	 āasan	
māre	ho

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا لَهَا عَـٰبِدِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“We	found	our	forefathers	worshipping	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	 hamne	 apne	 bāp	 dādā	 ko	 inki	 pujā	
karte	pāyā

arabicText: قَالَ لَقَدْ كُنتُمْ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُمْ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Indeed	you	all	- you	and	your	forefathers	- were	in	open	error.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaha:	be-shak	tum	Aur	tumhāre	bāp	dādā	sab	khuli	gumrāhi	meiñ	ho

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ أَمْ أَنتَ مِنَ ٱللَّـٰعِبِينَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Have	you	brought	the	Truth	to	us,	or	are	you	just	making	fun?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	kya	tum	hamāre	pās	haq	lāye	ho	ya	yuñhi	khelte	ho

arabicText: قَالَ بَل رَّبُّكُمْ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّذِى فَطَرَهُنَّ وَأَنَا۠ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰهِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“In	fact,	your	Lord	is	the	Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	the	One	Who	created	them;	
and	I	am	of	those	who	testify	to	it.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaha:- balke	tumhārā	Rab	woh	hai	jo	rab	hai	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	ka	jisne	inheiñ	paidā	kiya	
aur	mai	is	par	gawāhoñ	meiñ	se	huñ

arabicText: وَتَٱللَّهِ لَأَكِيدَنَّ أَصْنَـٰمَكُم بَعْدَ أَن تُوَلُّوا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And,	by	oath	of	Allah,	I	shall	seek	to	harm	your	idols	after	you	have	gone	away	and	turned	your	
backs.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	mujhe	Allah	ki	qasam	hai	maiñ	tumhāre	butoñ	ka	burā	chāhuñgā	b’ad	iske	ke	tum	phir	jāo	
peeth	dekar

arabicText: فَجَعَلَهُمْ جُذَٰذًا إِلَّا كَبِيرًۭا لَّهُمْ لَعَلَّهُمْ إِلَيْهِ يَرْجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 shattered	 them	 all,	 except	 the	 biggest	
among	 them,	 that	 perhaps	 they	 may	
question	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 un	 sabko	 choorā	 kardiyā	magar	ek	 ko	
jo	un	sab	Ka	Badā	thā	ke	shāyad	woh	usse	
kuch	pucheiñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ مَن فَعَلَ هَـٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَآ إِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “Who	 has	 done	 this	 to	 our	
Gods?	He	is indeed	cruel!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	 kisne	 hamāre	 khudāoñ	 ke	 sāth	 yeh	
kām	kiya?	Be-shak	woh	ƶālim	hai.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ سَمِعْنَا فَتًۭى يَذْكُرُهُمْ يُقَالُ لَهُۥٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Some	 among	 them	 said,	 “We	 heard	 a	
youth	 speak	 ill	 of	 them	 - the	 one	 called	
Ibrahim.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	meiñ	ke	kuch	bole	hamne	ek	jawān	ko	
inheiñ	burā	Kehte	sunā	jise	Ibrāhim	Kahte	
haiñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ فَأْتُوا۟ بِهِۦ عَلَىٰٓ أَعْيُنِ ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَشْهَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Therefore	bring	him	in	front	of	
the	people,	perhaps	they	may	testify.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	To	 usey	logoñ	 ke	 sāmne	lāo	 shāyad	
woh	gawāhi	deiñ

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَأَنتَ فَعَلْتَ هَـٰذَا بِـَٔالِهَتِنَا يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
They	said,	“Did	you	do	this	to	our	Gods,	O	
Ibrahim?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole:	kya	tumne	hamāre	khudāoñ	ke	sāth	
yeh	kām	kiya	aey	Ibrāhim?

arabicText: قَالَ بَلْ فَعَلَهُۥ كَبِيرُهُمْ هَـٰذَا فَسْـَٔلُوهُمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ يَنطِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	 he,	 “Rather,	 their	 chief	 may	 have	
done	 it;	 so	 question	 them,	 if	 they	 can	
speak.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā:	balke	inke	is	bade	ne	kiya	hogā,	
to	unse	puñcho	agar	bolte	hoñ

arabicText: فَرَجَعُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ فَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ أَنتُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. So	 they	 turned	 towards	 their	 own	 selves	
and	 (inwardly)	 said,	 “Indeed	 you	
yourselves	are	unjust.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apne	jee	ki	taraf	palte	aur	bole	be-shak	
tumheiñ	sitamgār	ho

arabicText: قَالَ أَفَتَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكُمْ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يَضُرُّكُمْ
englishTranslationText:
Again	 they	 were	 inverted	 upon	 their	
heads;	 saying,	 “You	 know	well	 that	 these	
do	not	speak.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	 apne	 saro	 ke	 bal	 auñdhāye	 gaye	 ke	
tumheiñ	 khoob	 m’aloom	 hai	 yeh	 bolte	
nahiñ

arabicText: أُفٍّۢ لَّكُمْ وَلِمَا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “What!	 You	 worship,	 instead	 of	
Allah,	 one	 that	 neither	 benefits	 you	 nor	
harms	you?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Kahā:	To	kya	Allah	ke	siwā	aise	ko	poojte	
ho	 jo	 na	 tumheiñ	 naf’a	 de	 na	 nuqsān	
pahuñchāye

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ حَرِّقُوهُ وَٱنصُرُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ فَـٰعِلِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“Disgrace	be	upon	you	and	all	the	idols	whom	you	worship	instead	of	Allah;	so	do	you	not	have	
sense?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tuf!	 Hai	 tumpar	 aur	 in	 butoñ	 par	 jinko	
Allah	ke	siwā	poojte	ho	to	kya	tumheiñ	aql	
nahiñ

arabicText: قُلْنَا يَـٰنَارُ كُونِى بَرْدًۭا وَسَلَـٰمًا عَلَىٰٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“Burn	him	and	help	your	Gods,	if	you	want	to.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bole:	Inko	jalādo	aur	apne	khudāoñ	ki	madad	karo	agar	tumheiñ	karnā	hai

arabicText: وَأَرَادُوا۟ بِهِۦ كَيْدًۭا فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرِينَ
englishTranslationText: We	said,	“O	fire,	become	cool	and	peaceful	upon	Ibrahim.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamne	farmāya:	aye	āg!	Hojā	thandi	aur	salāmati	Ibrāheem par

arabicText: وَنَجَّيْنَـٰهُ وَلُوطًا إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا لِلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	they	wished	to	cause	him	harm,	so	We	made	them	the	greatest	of	losers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	unhoñ	ne	uskā	burā	chāhā	to	hamne	unheiñ	sabse	badhkar	ziyāñ	kār	kardiyā

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةًۭ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا جَعَلْنَا صَـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	We	rescued	him	and	Lut	towards	the	land	which	We	have	blessed	for	the	entire	world.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	usey	aur	Lūt ko	najāt	Bakhshi us	zameen	ki	taraf	jis	meiñ	hamne	jahān	wāloñ	ke	
liye	barkat	rakhi

arabicText: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُۥٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ نَافِلَةًۭ ۖ وَكُلًّۭا جَعَلْنَا صَـٰلِحِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	bestowed	him	Ishaq,	and	Yaqub	the	grandson;	and	We	made	all	of	them	worthy	of	Our	
proximity.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 hamne	 Is’hāq ‘atā	 farmāyā	 aur	 Y’aqūb potā	 aur	 hamne	 un	 sab	 ko	 Apne	 Qurb-e-khās	 ka	
sazāwār	kiya
